<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<I>
	Luiz Fernando Furlan
</I>
	is 70 years old and is a member of the Boards of Directors of Telef&ocirc;nica Brasil S.A. (Brasil), Telef&oacute;nica S.A. (Spain),
	BRF S.A. (Brasil), AGCO Corporation (USA). He is member of the
<I>
	Conselho Superior de Gest&atilde;o em Sa&uacute;de P&uacute;blica
</I>
	of the State of S&atilde;o Paulo (Brazil) and Chairman of the Board of LIDE &ndash;
<I>
	Grupo de L&iacute;deres Empresariais
</I>
	(Brasil).
	Previously, he was Chairman of the Board of Directors at Sadia S.A., from 1993 to 2002 and from 2008 to 2009, company within which
	he held numerous executive positions from 1976 to 1993. He was Co-Chairman of the board of BRF Brasil Foods S.A. from 2009 to 2010,
	as well as a member of the board of Amil Participa&ccedil;&otilde;es S.A. from 2008 to 2013, as well as a member of the Advisory
	Board of Panasonic (Japan). He served as Minister of State at the
<I>
	Minist&eacute;rio de Desenvolvimento, Ind&uacute;stria e Com&eacute;rcio
	Exterior
</I>
	of Brazil from 2003 to 2007. He has been the Chairman of the Board of Directors of
<I>
	Funda&ccedil;&atilde;o Amazonas
	Sustent&aacute;vel
</I>
	&ldquo;FAS&rdquo; (Brazil) from 2008 to 2015, institution within which he has become an honorary member.
	He was also a commissioner member of Global Ocean Commission (USA) &ndash; 2013 to 2015. He holds a degree in Chemical Engineering
	from FEI (University of Industrial Engineering) and in Business Administration from University of Santana &ndash; S&atilde;o Paulo,
	with extension and specialization courses in Brazil and abroad.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 17.85PT">
<I>
	Narc&iacute;s
	Serra Serra
</I>
	is 73 years old and is as a member of our Board of Directors and of our Control and Audit Committee. He is the
	Vice President of Telef&oacute;nica Chile S.A. From 1991 to 1995, he was Vice President of the Spanish Government, and from 1982
	to 1991, served as Minister of Defense. From 1979 to 1982, he was the Mayor of Barcelona. Mr. Serra holds a doctorate in economics
	from the Universidad Aut&oacute;noma de Barcelona and is President of Barcelona Institute for International Studies (IBEI).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 17.85PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 17.85PT">
<I>
	Jos&eacute; Mar&iacute;a
	Del Rey Osorio
</I>
	is 65 years old and serves as a member of our Board of Directors and of our Strategy Committee. He holds a degree
	in Economy and Business Administration from the
<I>
	Universisad Aut&oacute;noma de Madrid
</I>
	. Since joining the Telef&ocirc;nica
	Group in 1983, he has acquired significant experience with the group, occupying, among other roles, the positions of General Manager
	of Strategic Planning of Telef&oacute;nica Internacional S.A., from 2001 to 2004; Vice-President of Strategy and Regulation of
	Telecomunica&ccedil;&otilde;es de S&atilde;o Paulo S.A. &ndash; TELESP, from 1999 to 2001; and Manager of Economic Analysis of
	Telef&oacute;nica S.A., from 1988 to 1998. Mr. Osorio acted as member of the Board of Directors of COSESA, ST-HILO, from 1990 to
	1996, of Telef&oacute;nica Investigaci&oacute;n y Desarrollo S.A., from 2003 to 2005, and from Telef&ocirc;nica del Per&uacute;,
	from 2005 to 2012, among other companies. Before joining the Telef&ocirc;nica Group, he worked at
<I>
	Servicios de Estudios Econ&oacute;micos
	de EDES E INITEC
</I>
	, in the National Institute of Industry&rsquo;s (INI) companies and in the management and planning of the INI&rsquo;s
	corporation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 17.85PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<I>
	Roberto Oliveira de Lima
</I>
	is 65 years
	old and serves as a member of our Board of Directors and a member of the Service Quality and Marketing Committee. His career includes
	positions in the areas of information technology, finance and general administration in companies such as Saint Gobain, Rhodia
	and Accor. From 1999 to 2005, he was Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Credicard Group and CEO of the Banco Credicard.
	From 2005 to 2011, he was the Chief Executive Officer of Vivo Participa&ccedil;&otilde;es S.A. and Vivo S.A. Since then he has
	served on the boards of companies such as Edenred, located in Paris - France, Naspers Holdings in South Africa and Grupo P&atilde;o
	de A&ccedil;&uacute;car, Rodobens and Natura Brazil. From January to August 2014, he became Chairman of the Publicis Group Worldwide
	in Brazil. From September 2014 to October 2016 he was the Chief Executive Officer of Natura Cosm&eacute;ticos S.A. He holds a degree
	in Public Administration and a MBA from Funda&ccedil;&atilde;o Get&uacute;lio Vargas, Brazil. He also holds a master&rsquo;s degree
	in Finance and Strategic Planning from the Institute Superieur des Affaires, Jouy en Josas, France.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	There is no family relationship between
	any of the directors named above. There is no arrangement or understanding with major shareholders, customers, suppliers or others,
	pursuant to which any director referred to above was selected as such.
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Board of Executive Officers
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The Board of Executive Officers consists
	of at least three (3) and no more than 15 members, who may or may not be our shareholders, must be resident in the country, are
	appointed by our Board of Directors for a period of three (3) years, may be reelected, and who may remain in office until reappointed
	or replaced. Our Board of Executive Officers is responsible for our day-to-day management and for representing us in our business
	with third parties. Any of our executive officers may be removed at any time by a decision of the Board of Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The following are the current members of
	the Board of Executive Officers, their respective positions and the date of their appointment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<A NAME="FIS_NAME_AND_TITLE_2"></A>

	Position
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 19%; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT">

	of Appointment

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Set forth below are brief biographies of
	our executive officers:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<I>
	Breno Rodrigo Pacheco
	de Oliveira
</I>
	is 41 years old and serves as General Secretary and Legal Officer of Telef&ocirc;nica Brasil S.A., Innoweb Ltda.,
	POP Internet Ltda. and Telef&ocirc;nica Data S.A. He is also Corporate Secretary of our Board of Directors, member and Chairman
	of the Deliberative Council of Vis&atilde;o Prev Sociedade de Previd&ecirc;ncia Complementar and Officer of SP Telecomunica&ccedil;&otilde;es
	Participa&ccedil;&otilde;es Ltda. Mr. Oliveira is also Corporate Secretary and member of the Board of Directors of Telef&ocirc;nica
	Factoring do Brasil Ltda., Corporate Secretary and member of the Board of Directors of Telef&ocirc;nica Corretora de Seguros Ltda.,
	Chairman and member of the Board of Directors of Companhia ACT de Participa&ccedil;&otilde;es and Companhia AIX de Participa&ccedil;&otilde;es
	and member of the Board of Directors of Tectotal Tecnologia sem Complica&ccedil;&otilde;es S.A. He was General Secretary and Legal
	Officer of Global Village Telecom S.A. and GVT Participa&ccedil;&otilde;es S.A., until April 1, 2016, when these companies were
	merged into Telef&ocirc;nica Brasil S.A. He was also Officer of the following merged companies: Vivo S.A., A.Telecom S.A., Telef&ocirc;nica
	Sistema de Televis&atilde;o S.A., Ajato Telecomunica&ccedil;&atilde;o Ltda., Lemontree Participa&ccedil;&otilde;es S.A., TVA Sul
	Paran&aacute; S.A., GTR-T Participa&ccedil;&otilde;es e Empreendimentos S.A. and Comercial Cabo TV S&atilde;o Paulo S.A. until
	July 1, 2013, when these companies were merged into us. He was also General Secretary and Legal Officer from February 3, 2011 to
	October 3, 2011 of Vivo Participa&ccedil;&otilde;es S.A. (when it was merged into the company) and of Vivo S.A. from April 2005
	to February 2011. He holds a law degree from Universidade do Vale do Rio dos Sinos &ndash; UNISINOS, Brazil.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<I>
	David Melcon Sanchez
	Friera
</I>
	is 46 years old and Chief Financial and Investor Relations Officer of Telefonica Brasil since April 8, 2016. He is also
	Financial Officer of Innoweb Ltda., POP Internet Ltda. and Telef&ocirc;nica Data S.A., Officer of SP Telecomunica&ccedil;&otilde;es
	Participa&ccedil;&otilde;es Ltda. and Vice Chairman of Telefonica Corretora de Seguros Ltda. &nbsp;Mr. Melcon has more than 20
	years of experience as Financial Officer in the Telecommunications industry in Latin America and European countries. He was the
	Transformation Officer of the Telefonica Group from 2015 to 2016. From 2012 to 2014 he was Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors
	and Chief Financial Officer of Telefonica Czech Republic; from 2007 to 2012 he held the position of Financial and Control Officer
	of the Telefonica Group in Europe and worked as Executive of the Financial Department of Telefonica Latinoamerica and of the Telefonica
	M&oacute;viles Group from 2005 to 2007. Before that, he held senior roles at Telefonica S.A. from 2001 to 2005, and began his career
	working at Arthur Andersen from 1996 to 2001.&nbsp;Mr. Melcon was also Chairman of the Supervisory Board of Telefonica Slovakia
	from 2013 to 2014 and, in the same period, he was a member of the Board of Directors of Tesco Mobile Czech Republic.&nbsp;From
	2010 to 2011, he was a member of the Supervisory Board of Hansenet, in Germany and member of the Board of Directors of Telfin Ireland
	from 2010 to 2012.&nbsp;Mr. Melcon holds a degree in Economic and Business Administration from the University of Zaragoza (Spain),
	and a Master in Audit and Business Analysis from the University Complutense &ndash; Madrid (Spain).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	For the biography
	of Eduardo Navarro de Carvalho, see &ldquo;&mdash;C. Board Practices&mdash;Board of Directors.&rdquo;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	There is no family relationship between
	any of the executive officers named above. There is no arrangement or understanding with major shareholders, customers, suppliers
	or others, pursuant to which any executive officer referred to above was selected as such.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD>
	Compensation
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	For the year ended December 31, 2016, the
	aggregate amount of compensation paid to all our directors and executive officers was approximately R$109.3 million, of which R$39.8
	million corresponded to salaries and R$69.5 million corresponded to bonuses.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	For the
	year ended December 31, 2016, our directors and officers did not receive any pension, retirement or similar benefits. For a description
	of our pension plan, see &ldquo;&mdash;D. Employees&mdash;Pension Plans.&rdquo;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	C.
</TD>
<TD>
	Board Practices
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Board of Directors
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Our Board of Directors typically meets
	once every three months and the Chairman may call special meetings. Our Board takes action by majority vote, provided the majority
	of its members in office are present, with the Chairman having, in addition to his or her regular vote, the deciding vote in the
	event of a tie. The specific responsibilities of the Chairman include representing the Board in the General Shareholders Meetings,
	chairing the General Shareholders Meetings, selecting the Secretary from among those present, and calling and chairing meetings
	of the Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Our Board of Directors is responsible,
	among other things, for:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</FONT>

</TD>

	&nbsp;

	with due regard for legal and statutory provisions;
</TD>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

	and setting limits on the practice of such acts by the officers;
</TD>

	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;

	may delegate such powers to the officers and establish limits, as it seeks to develop activities in line with the company&rsquo;s
	purpose;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</P>

	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	setting the limits for the officers to authorize the practice of reasonable gratuitous acts for the benefit of employees or
	the community of which the company is a part of, including the donation of unserviceable assets to the company; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	approving the creation and dissolution of subsidiaries of the company, in Brazil or abroad.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	One of the members of our Board of Directors
	was elected by the preferred shareholders in a separate voting process and the others were elected by the holders of common shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Fiscal Board
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Brazilian Corporate Law and our bylaws
	each require that we maintain a statutory Fiscal Board (
<I>
	Conselho Fiscal
</I>
	). Our permanent, statutory Fiscal Board, which is
	a separate and distinct entity from our outside auditors, is primarily charged with certain advisory, reporting, oversight and
	review functions with respect to the company&rsquo;s financial statements. Our statutory Fiscal Board is also responsible for rendering
	opinions on management&rsquo;s annual report and management proposals, including financial statements, to be submitted at shareholders
	meetings relating to a change in the company&rsquo;s capital composition, investment plans, budget, debenture issuances or subscription
	bonuses, payment of dividends and consolidations, mergers and spin-offs. However, the statutory Fiscal Board, as required by Brazilian
	Corporate Law and our bylaws, has only an advisory role and does not participate in the management of the company. Indeed, decisions
	of the statutory Fiscal Board are not binding on the company under Brazilian Corporate Law.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 90; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In accordance with
	Brazilian Corporate Law and our bylaws, the Fiscal Board consists of a minimum of three&nbsp;(3) and a maximum of five (5) active
	members and an equal number of alternates. The members of the Fiscal Board are elected for a period of one (1) year and may be
	reelected.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	One member of the Fiscal Board and his
	or her alternate must be elected by holders of preferred shares in a separate voting process. The following are the current members
	of the Fiscal Board:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 33%; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
	Members
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 45%; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
	Alternates
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 22%; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT">

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Committees
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Brazilian Corporate Law does not require
	a corporation to maintain committees responsible for ethics, corporate governance or compensation. Nevertheless, our Board of Directors
	has created the following committees:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Control and Audit Committee;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Nominations, Compensation and Corporate Governance Committee; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Service Quality and Marketing Committee; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Strategy Committee.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Control and Audit Committee
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Our Control and Audit Committee was created
	by our Board of Directors in December 2002 and comprises a minimum of three (3) and a maximum of five (5) directors, who are not
	members of our Board of Executive Officers, and who are appointed by the Board of Directors to serve as members of the Control
	and Audit Committee for the duration of their respective terms as members of the Board of Directors. The Committee has its own
	charter, which was approved by the Board of Directors. The Committee provides support to the Board of Directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	According to its charter, the Control and
	Audit Committee shall meet four (4) times per year (once every three (3) months) and report its conclusions to the Board of Directors.
	Our Control and Audit Committee and our statutory Fiscal Board may have some similar attributes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The Control and Audit Committee, among
	other responsibilities that may be required by the Board of Directors, is charged with informing and providing recommendations
	to the Board of Directors regarding the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	the appointment of the independent auditors, the terms and conditions of their contracts and, if necessary, their termination
	and renewal;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	the analysis of the company&rsquo;s accounts, compliance with certain legal requirements and the adoption of generally accepted
	accounting principles;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	the results of each internal and independent audit and management&rsquo;s response to the auditor&rsquo;s recommendations;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	the quality and integrity of the company&rsquo;s internal control systems;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	the performance of the independent auditors, requesting that their opinions on the company&rsquo;s annual reports and the contents
	of the main audit reports be clear and precise; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	any communications with the internal auditors about any significant deficiencies in our control systems and identified financial
	conditions.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Nominations, Compensation and Corporate
	Governance Committee
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Our Nominations, Compensation and Corporate
	Governance Committee was established in November 1998, and was restructured in October 2004, and consists of three (3) to five
	(5) directors appointed by the Board of Directors to serve for the duration of their respective terms as members of the Board of
	Directors. The Committee meets from time to time, depending on the availability of its members and when called by its chair. The
	Nominations, Compensation and Corporate Governance Committee, among other responsibilities that may be required by the Board of
	Directors, is charged with informing and providing recommendations to the Board of Directors regarding the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	the appointment of executive officers for our company and our subsidiaries;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	the parameters on compensation for our executive officers and administrators;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;
</P>

</TD>

</TD>

<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(213,234,234)">

	Luis Francisco Javier Bastida Ibarg&uuml;en&#9;

	June 10, 2016

<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Service Quality and Marketing Committee
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The Service Quality and Marketing Committee
	was created on December 16, 2004 and provides assistance to our Board of Directors. The Committee consists of at least three (3),
	and at most five (5), members of our Board of Directors selected periodically to serve for the duration of their respective terms
	as members of the Board of Directors. The Committee meets from time to time, depending on the availability of its members and when
	called by its chair. The Committee is responsible for review and analysis of quality indices measuring our principal services and
	to ensure that the requisite degree of commercial assistance is furnished to our clients.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">

	Members
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 31%; PADDING-RIGHT: 10PT">
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID">
	Date
	Appointed
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Strategy Committee
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The Strategy Committee was created
	on October 7, 2016 and provides assistance to our Board of Directors. The Strategy Committee consists of at least three (3),
	and at most five (5), members of our Board of Directors selected periodically to serve for the duration of their respective
	terms as members of the Board of Directors. The Strategy Committee meets from time to time, depending on the availability of
	its members and when called by its chair. The Strategy Committee is responsible for reviewing and monitoring the Company and
	the group&rsquo;s strategy policy in Brazil.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE">

<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 92; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;

	85
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->

<A NAME="eolPage93"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP73142_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	D.
</TD>
<TD>
	Employees
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	As of December 31, 2016, we had 33,331
	employees. We have full-time and part-time employees. Our part-time employees work primarily at our stores and call centers. Our
	employees are divided into the following categories: 36.8% in production and operations; 35.9% in sales; 19.6%in customer care;
	and 7.7% in support.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	As of December 31, 2015, we had 33,847
	employees. We have full-time and part-time employees. Our part-time employees work primarily at our stores and call centers. Our
	employees are divided into the following categories: 38.0% in production and operations; 34.5% in sales; 19.7%in customer care;
	and 7.8% in support.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	As of December 31, 2014, we had 18,419
	employees. We have full-time and part-time employees. Our part-time employees work primarily at our stores and call centers. Our
	employees are divided into the following categories: 26.33% in production and operations; 60.0% in sales; 4.1%in customer care;
	and 9.6% in support.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Approximately 9.2% of our employees are
	union members. These unions have state representation, so we have employees represented by the unions of all 26 states plus the
	Federal District. In turn, 19 of these unions are associated with the National Federation of Telecommunications Workers (Fenattel)
	and other 8 unions are associated with the Interstate Federation of Workers and Researchers in Telecommunications (Fitratelp).
	Besides these 27 unions, we have employees represented by S&atilde;o Paulo Engineers&rsquo; Union.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Our collective bargaining agreement for
	these employees was renewed for 100% of our employees on September 1, 2016 and will expire on August 31, 2017 for economic clauses
	and on August 31, 2018 for social clauses.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Our management considers relations with
	our work force to be very good. We have never experienced a work stoppage for a significant period or that had a material effect
	on our operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Pension Plans
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Before December 1999, the SISTEL plan (managed
	by the
<I>
	Funda&ccedil;&atilde;o Sistel de Seguridade Social
</I>
	), was a defined benefit plan that supplemented government-provided
	retirement benefits, was adopted for all the employees of the former Telebr&aacute;s System and we were contingently liable for
	all of the unfunded obligations of the plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In January 2000, we and the other companies
	that formerly belonged to the Telebr&aacute;s system agreed to divide the existing SISTEL plan into 15 separate plans, resulting
	in the creation of private plans covering those employees already enrolled in the SISTEL plan. These new private pension plans,
	called PBS plans, were still administered by the
<I>
	Funda&ccedil;&atilde;o Sistel
</I>
	and have retained the same terms and conditions
	of the initial plan. The division was carried out to allocate liability among the companies that formerly belonged to the Telebr&aacute;s
	system according to each company&rsquo;s contributions with respect to its own employees. Joint liability among the SISTEL plan
	sponsors continues with respect to retired employees, who will necessarily remain members of the PBS plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Under the PBS plans, we made monthly contributions
	to each plan according to a percentage of the salary of each employee who was a participant of such plan. Each employee member
	also made a monthly contribution to their plan on the basis of age and salary. Pension benefits of members of PBS plans vested
	at the same time their retirement benefits vested under the government-provided retirement plan.
<I>
	Funda&ccedil;&atilde;o Sistel
</I>
	operates independently from us, and its assets and liabilities are fully segregated.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Beginning in 2000, we decided to establish
	defined contributions plans, and offered these to participants in our PBS plans, as well as to employees who do not already have
	a pension plan. Unlike the PBS plans, which are defined benefits plans, the defined contribution plans are financed by contributions
	from participating employees, as well as by our contributions as sponsor, which are credited to the individual accounts of the
	participants. We are responsible for all management and maintenance expenses of these plans, including the risks of death and permanent
	injury of the participants.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 93; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	86
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage94"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP73142_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In 2005, we created a closed social security
	entity called Vis&atilde;o Prev Sociedade de Previd&ecirc;ncia Complementar to manage the pension plans of the Telef&oacute;nica
	group in Brazil. From 2005 to 2010, management of all plans was transferred from
<I>
	Funda&ccedil;&atilde;o Sistel
</I>
	to Vis&atilde;o
	Prev, except for PBS-A Plan, which continues to be managed by
<I>
	Funda&ccedil;&atilde;o Sistel
</I>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In 2011, the Vis&atilde;o Telesp, Vis&atilde;o
	Telef&ocirc;nica Empresas, Vis&atilde;o Assist and Vis&atilde;o ATelecom plans were consolidated into the Vis&atilde;o Telef&ocirc;nica
	plan. Following the acquisition of the Tevecap S.A., or TVA, we became sponsors of Abrilprev Plan, a defined contribution plan
	for employees of these companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	On September 1, 2013, we began offering
	the Vis&atilde;o Multi Pension Plan to our employees who do not have a pension plan. This plan was launched in order to standardize
	private pension benefits following the corporate restructuring of our subsidiaries in Brazil. In this plan, participants can make
	basic contributions of 1-2% and additional contributions of 0-5% of salary and we contribute a percentage between 50% to 125%,
	depending on length of service.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In July 2014, a spin-off of the Abrilprev
	plan covering employees of the TVA companies was approved and its management transferred to Vis&atilde;o Prev. This plan is now
	called Vis&atilde;o TVA.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In September 2015, the merger of the plans
	CelPrev Telemig, Vis&atilde;o Celular CRT, Vis&atilde;o Telebahia Celular, Vis&atilde;o Telergipe Celular, Vis&atilde;o Telerj
	Celular, Vis&atilde;o Telest Celular, TCP Prev by the plan Vis&atilde;o Telef&ocirc;nica was approved. Also in September 2015 the
	merger of the plan Vis&atilde;o TVA by the plan Vis&atilde;o Multi was approved.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In May 2015, the company also became a
	sponsor of private pension plans of the open entity Brasilprev, that were offered to the employees of the GVT Group companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Between January and March 2016, the process
	of migration of the 259 participants of the Brasilprev plan to the Vis&atilde;o Multi plan was carried out.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In 2016, we sought to improve efficiency
	in the management of private pension plans, aligning the main market practices, and standardizing the benefit through actions of:
	(i) implementing the collection in July of administrative fees from the participants for the maintenance of the Vis&atilde;o Multi
	plan; (ii) reversion of 100% of the value of the leftover fund to the company (50% were reverted until 2015, the other part being
	allocated to the participants); (iii) incorporation of plans managed by Vis&atilde;o Prev.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In March 2016, the process of incorporating
	the PBS Telemig plan to the Telef&oacute;nica BD plan was approved.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In November 2016, the incorporation of
	the Vis&atilde;o Terra plan to the Vis&atilde;o Multi plan was approved.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In December 2016, the incorporations of
	the Vis&atilde;o TGestiona and Vivo Prev plans to the Vis&atilde;o Telef&ocirc;nica Plan were approved, and will be completed in
	the first quarter of 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Considering the total workforce, 26.2%
	of our employees are participants of our private retirement plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	E.
</TD>
<TD>
	Share Ownership
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	None of our directors or executive officers
	beneficially owns, on an individual basis, 1% or more of our common or preferred shares (including ADSs representing preferred
	shares) or of our total equity share capital. We currently have two share ownership plans in place:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<B>
<I>
	1)
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Performance &amp; Investment Plan (&ldquo;PIP&rdquo;)
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The general shareholders&rsquo; meeting
	of Telef&oacute;nica S.A. (our indirect controlling shareholder), held on May 18, 2011, approved a new long-term incentive plan
	&ndash; Performance &amp; Investment Plan, or the PIP, for executives of Telef&oacute;nica S.A. and of other entities within the
	Telef&oacute;nica group, including us. The plan grants a certain number of shares of Telef&oacute;nica S.A. to selected participants
	who meet the necessary requirements of the program.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The new PIP program was divided in three
	cycles (2011, 2012 and 2013), each of which has a three-year duration, with the start date of each cycle occurring in July 1 of
	each year. The cycles are independent of each other.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 94; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	87
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage95"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP73142_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The executives of Telef&oacute;nica group
	are eligible to participate in the program and they must remain in the Telef&oacute;nica group for a minimum period of three years
	starting from the date they were qualified. In order to deliver the shares to executives at the end of each three-year cycle, the
	Telef&oacute;nica group performs an analysis to determine if the evaluation indicators of the shares of Telef&oacute;nica, which
	are primarily measured in terms of the total return to shareholders, or TRS, have been achieved.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The distribution of shares related to the
	first cycle (2011-2014) did not occur, given that the minimum TRS set forth in the program was not achieved.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The 2012-2015 cycle ended in June 2015
	and, after reaching the TSR, 68 executives of the Company were entitled to receive 258,552 shares of Telef&oacute;nica S.A..
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The 2013-2016 cycle ended in June 2016
	and the distribution of shares did not occur, given that the minimum TRS set forth in the program was not achieved.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In 2014, Telef&ocirc;nica approved the
	extension of this program for three cycles, each lasting three years, beginning on October 1, 2014 and ending on September 30,
	2017. The number of shares is communicated early in the cycle, and after the period of three years from the grant date, the shares
	are transferred to the participant if the specified TRS is reached.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The next distributions of shares are scheduled
	as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Cycle 2014-2017: scheduled to occur in September 2017, with 66 executives (including three executives appointed pursuant to
	the bylaws) of Telef&ocirc;nica Brasil having the potential right to receive 365,215 shares of Telef&oacute;nica S.A. (including
	initial shares and co-investing), which, as of December 31, 2016, accrued R$6.3 million.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

	the bylaws) of Telef&ocirc;nica Brasil having the potential right to receive 581,899 shares of Telef&oacute;nica S.A. (including
	initial shares and co-investing), which, as of December 31, 2016, accrued R$5.3 million.
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<B>
<I>
	2)
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Global Employee Share Plan (&ldquo;GESP&rdquo;)
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The program is only available to certain
	director-level executives, not including members of the Boards of Directors and Fiscal Board.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Telef&oacute;nica's Annual Shareholders'
	Meeting, held on May 30, 2014, approved an incentive plan for the acquisition of Telef&oacute;nica&rsquo;s shares by the Telef&oacute;nica
	Group employees at an international level, including employees of the Company and its subsidiaries. Through this plan, the possibility
	of acquiring shares of Telef&oacute;nica is offered, with a certain number of shares being delivered to participants whenever certain
	requirements are met.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The total planned duration of the plan
	was 2 years. The employees enrolled in the plan were able to acquire shares of Telef&oacute;nica through monthly contributions
	of 25 to 150 euros (or equivalent in local currency), with a maximum value of 1,800 euros over a period of 12 months (period of
	purchase).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The delivery of shares will occur after
	the vesting of rights pursuant to the plan, as from July 31, 2017, and is conditioned on: (i) continued employment with the company
	during the two-year duration of the program (the rights vesting period), subject to certain special conditions relating to casualties;
	and (ii) the exact number of shares to be delivered at the end of the vesting period depends on the number of shares acquired and
	held by employees. Thus, the employees enrolled in the plan who remained in the Telef&oacute;nica Group and held the shares acquired
	for an additional period of twelve months after the end of the purchase period are entitled to receive a free share for each share
	they have acquired and held until the end of the vesting period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">

	3)
</I>

</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The Annual General Shareholders&rsquo;
	Meeting of Telef&oacute;nica held in 2014 approved a long-term program to reward the commitment, outstanding performance and high
	potential of its executives globally with the allocation of shares of Telef&oacute;nica.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage96"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Participants do not need to pay for their
	initial shares. The initially expected total duration of the plan is three years. The beginning of the cycle was on October 1,
	2014 and will last until September 30, 2017. The number of shares is stated in the beginning of the cycle and, after the period
	of three years from the grant date, the shares will be transferred to the participant if the goal is reached.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The delivery of shares is conditional upon:
	(i) maintain an active working relationship in the Telef&oacute;nica Group at the date of the cycle&rsquo;s consolidation; and
	(ii) the achievement of results which represent the fulfillment of the objectives set for the plan. The level of success is based
	on the comparison of the evolution of shareholder remuneration considering price and dividends (Total Shareholder Return - TSR)
	of Telef&oacute;nica share, vis-&agrave;-vis the evolution of TSRs corresponding to a number of companies quoted in the telecommunications
	industry, which correspond to the Comparison Group. The maximum number of shares allocated in the first open cycle on December&nbsp;31,
	2016 is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	Cycle 2014-2017: scheduled to occur in September 2017, with 61 executives of Telef&ocirc;nica Brasil having the potential right
	to receive 58,000 initial shares of Telef&oacute;nica S.A., which, as of December 31, 2016, accrued R$1.0 million.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;

<EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<A NAME="FIS_SECURITY_OWNERS"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.75IN">
<A NAME="DP73142_20F_HTM_I7">
</A>
	ITEM 7.
</TD>
<TD>
	MAJOR SHAREHOLDERS AND RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD>
	Major Shareholders
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In accordance with our bylaws, we have
	two classes of capital stock authorized and outstanding: common shares (
<I>
	a&ccedil;&otilde;es ordin&aacute;rias
</I>
	) and preferred
	shares (
<I>
	a&ccedil;&otilde;es preferenciais
</I>
	). Our common shares have full voting rights. Our preferred shares have voting
	rights only under limited circumstances.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	On October 31, 2016, Telef&ocirc;nica Brasil
	received a correspondence from the shareholder Telef&oacute;nica Latinoam&eacute;rica Holding, S.L. stating that Telef&oacute;nica
	Internacional, S.A. transferred to them their entire stake in the Company, or 24.09% of the Company's capital, represented by 46,746,635
	common shares (8.18% of such class) and 360,532,578 preferred shares (32.22% of such class). The transfer of shareholding was held
	due to a universal succession under an internal reorganization in the Telef&oacute;nica Group, through which Telef&oacute;nica
	Internacional, S.A. was merged into Telef&oacute;nica Latinoam&eacute;rica Holding, S.L.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	As a result, on December 31, 2016, Telef&oacute;nica
	S.A. owned 34.67% of our common shares, Telef&oacute;nica Latinoam&eacute;rica Holding, S.L. owned 8.18% of our common shares and
	SP Telecomunica&ccedil;&otilde;es owned 51.46% of our common shares. Since Telef&oacute;nica Latinoam&eacute;rica Holding, S.L.
	is a wholly owned subsidiary of Telef&oacute;nica and owns 60.60% of the equity share capital of SP Telecomunica&ccedil;&otilde;es,
	Telef&oacute;nica has effective control over 94.47% of our outstanding common shares. Accordingly, Telef&oacute;nica has the ability
	to control the election of our Board of Directors and to determine the direction of our strategic and corporate policies. None
	of Telef&oacute;nica, Telef&oacute;nica Latinoam&eacute;rica Holding, S.L. or SP Telecomunica&ccedil;&otilde;es has any special
	voting rights beyond those ordinarily accompanying the ownership of our common and preferred shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Telef&oacute;nica S.A.&rsquo;s shares are
	traded on various stock exchanges, including exchanges in Madrid, Barcelona, Bilbao, Valencia, London, New York, Lima and Buenos
	Aires.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Telef&oacute;nica is one of the largest
	telecommunications companies in the world in terms of market capitalization and number of customers. With its strong mobile, fixed
	and broadband networks, and its innovative portfolio of digital solutions, Telef&oacute;nica is transforming itself into a &ldquo;Digital
	Telco,&rdquo; a company that will be even better placed to meet the needs of its customers and capture new revenue growth.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	The following tables set forth information
	relating to the ownership of common and preferred shares by Telef&oacute;nica, SP Telecomunica&ccedil;&otilde;es, Telef&oacute;nica
	Latinoam&eacute;rica Holding, S.L., any other shareholders known to us to beneficially own more than 5% of our common or preferred
	shares and our officers and directors, based on 571,644,217 common shares and 1,119,340,706 preferred shares outstanding as of
	December 31, 2016. We are not aware of any other shareholder that beneficially owns more than 5% of our common or preferred shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_BENEFICIAL_OWNERS>

<!-- FIELD: /RULE-PAGE -->
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD>
	The number of preferred shares beneficially owned is as of December 31, 2016, as reported in a Schedule 13G filed by Artisan
	Partners Limited Partnership, Artisan Investments GP LLC, Artisan Partners Holdings LP and Artisan Partners Asset Management Inc.
	on February 3, 2017. As set forth in the Schedule 13G, Artisan Partners Limited Partnership has shared power to vote 65,136,571
	preferred shares and shared power to dispose of 72,321,188 preferred shares.
	As set forth in the Schedule 13G, Artisan Partners Limited Partnership does not have shared power to vote the remaining 7,184,617
	preferred shares which Artisan Partners Limited Partnership has reported in its Schedule 13G that it beneficially owns. Securities
	reported on the Schedule 13G as being beneficially owned by Artisan Partners Limited Partnership are held by Artisan Partners Limited
	Partnership and/or one or more of its investment adviser subsidiaries on behalf of investment advisory clients, which may include
	investment companies registered under the Investment Company Act, employee benefit plans, pension funds or other institutional
	clients. The business address of Artisan Partners Limited Partnership reported on the Schedule 13G is 875 East Wisconsin Avenue,
	Suite 800, Milwaukee, WI 53202.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	As of December 31, 2016, there were a total
	of 242 ADR holders of record and 186,139,798 ADRs outstanding, representing 186,139,798 preferred shares or 17% of outstanding
	preferred shares. Since some of these ADRs are held by nominees, the number of record holders may not be representative of the
	number of beneficial holders.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD>
	Related Party Transactions
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Transactions with related parties are submitted
	to review by our related parties committee and, when necessary, approval by our board of directors and shareholders, in compliance
	with our bylaws. We believe that all related party transactions are carried out according to guidelines, criteria and market rules
	in order to provide sufficient transparency to contracts between related parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Note 29 to our consolidated financial statements
	presents, in tabular format, more detailed financial information with respect to transactions and balances with related parties.
	We provide below a summary description of our material transactions with related parties to which we are currently party or have
	been party in the last three years.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Telef&oacute;nica S.A.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	On January 2, 2008, we entered into a copyright
	licensing agreement, or Brand Fee agreement with Telef&oacute;nica S.A., with respect to the brand &ldquo;Telefonica.&rdquo; The
	amounts in connection with these agreements totaled R$337 million in 2016, R$337 million in 2015 and R$327 million in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Telxius Cable Brasil Ltda (former Telef&ocirc;nica
	Internacional Wholesales Services Brasil Ltda.)
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	On June 3, 2002, we entered into a supply
	agreement for the IP Band with Telef&ocirc;nica Internacional Wholesales Services Brasil Ltda., with respect to the internet transit
	service, which is a connection dedicated to the transportation of internet traffic. The amounts in connection with these agreements
	totaled R$176 million in 2016, R$174 million in 2015 and R$147 million in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Some international roaming services are
	provided by companies in the Telef&oacute;nica group.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Telef&oacute;nica International Wholesale
	Services, S.L
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	On April 7, 2016, we entered into a supply
	agreement for the IP Band with Telef&ocirc;nica Internacional Wholesale Services S.L ., with respect to the internet transit service,
	which is a connection dedicated to the transportation of internet traffic.&nbsp;The amounts in connection with these agreements
	totaled&nbsp;R$49 million in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Telxius Torres Brasil Ltda.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	On March 31, 2016, we entered into a supply
	agreement for the use of infrastructure owned by Telxius Torres Brasil Ltda by the Company. The amounts in connection with said
	agreement totaled R$71 million in 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	C.
</TD>
<TD>
	Interests of Experts and Counsel
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Not applicable.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;

<EFX_LEGAL_PROCEEDINGS>

<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">

	to the normal course of our business. The main categories of such proceedings include:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	, the National Institute of Social
	Security, or INSS;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">

</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD>
	other civil suits, including litigation arising out of the breakup of Telebr&aacute;s and events preceding the breakup.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	Our policy with respect to provisioning
	for contingencies classifies the various legal proceedings to which we are party as &ldquo;probable,&rdquo; &ldquo;possible&rdquo;
	and &ldquo;remote.&rdquo; We and our subsidiaries are parties to labor, tax, civil and regulatory claims and set up a provision
	for contingencies for which the likelihood of loss was estimated as probable. Our senior management classifies each legal proceeding
	into one of these three categories (probable, possible and remote) based upon the advice of internal and external counsel and specialized
	technical advisors in charge of each matter. Due to the level of provisioning and based on its analysis of the individual cases,
	our management believes that no additional liabilities related to any legal proceedings will have a material effect on our financial
	condition or results of operations, other than as described below.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	There are no material proceedings in which
	any of our directors, any members of our senior management, or any of our affiliates is either a party adverse to us or to our
	subsidiaries or has a material interest adverse to us or to our subsidiaries.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	Tax Matters &mdash; Probable Loss
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	Federal Taxes
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: ITALIC BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 9.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	On December 31, 2016, the company was party
	to federal administrative and judicial proceedings relating to (i) claims resulting from the non-ratification of compensation and
	refund requests, formulated by the company; (ii) social contributions relating to an alleged failure to pay 11% on the value of
	invoices, billing and receipts from service providers hired for the transfer of labor; (iii) CIDE (Contribution for Intervention
	in the Economic Domain) levied on the remittance of funds abroad relating to technical services, administrative assistance and
	to services of similar nature, as well as royalties; (iv) fixed: non-inclusion of interconnection and EILD expenses in the FUST
	and FUNTTEL base and wireless: non-inclusion of revenues from interconnection in the FUST and FUNTTEL tax base; (v) contribution
	to
<I>
	Empresa Brasileira de Comunica&ccedil;&atilde;o
</I>
	, created by Law No. 11,652/08; (vi) TFI/TFF on mobile stations; (vii)
	IRRF on interest on shareholder&rsquo;s equity; (viii) Public Price for Numbering Resources Management (PPNUM) by ANATEL instituted
	by Resolution No. 451/06; (ix) Social Investment Fund (Finsocial) offset amounts; (x) failure to pay withholding social contribution
	levied on services rendered, remuneration, salaries and other salary bases; (xi) COFINS &ndash; Requirement resulting from non-inclusion
	of financial income into the tax base; and (xii) additional charges to the PIS and COFINS tax base, as well as additional charges
	to COFINS required by Law No. 9718/98.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	In the opinion of management, the chances
	of loss in the foregoing federal administrative and judicial proceedings is probable. On December 31, 2016, total consolidated
	provisions for these federal administrative and judicial proceedings amounted to R$2,872.6 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
