</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
	The amounts of IOE are calculated and stated net of Withholding Income
	Tax (IRRF). The immune shareholders received the full IOE amount, without withholding income tax at source.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0">
	e.3)
<U>
	Unclaimed dividends and interest on equity
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Pursuant to article 287, paragraph
	II, item &ldquo;a&rdquo; of Law No. 6404, of December 15, 1976, the dividends and interest on equity unclaimed by shareholders
	expire in 3 (three) years, as from the initial payment date. The Company reverses the amount of unclaimed dividends and IOE to
	equity upon expiry.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For the years ended December
	31, 2016 and 2015, the Company reversed unclaimed dividends and interest on equity amounting to R$189,471 and R$137,273, respectively,
	which were included in calculations for decisions on Company dividends.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	f)
<U>
	Other comprehensive
	income
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Financial instruments available
	for sale:
</U>
	These refer to changes in fair value of financial assets available for sale.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Derivative financial instruments:
</U>
	These refer to the effective part of cash flow hedges up to the balance sheet date. The variation is mainly due to realization
	of derivatives related to the acquisition and payment of GVTPart. in May 2015 (Note 4).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Currency translation effects
	for foreign investments:
</U>
	This refers to currency translation differences arising from the translation of financial statements
	of Alian&ccedil;a (jointly-controlled entity).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Balances at 12/31/14

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In a meeting held on December
	9, 2015, the Company&rsquo;s Board of Directors, in accordance with article 17, item XV, of the Articles of Incorporation, approved
	the repurchase of common and preferred shares issued by the Company, under CVM Ruling No. 567, of September 17, 2015, for acquisition
	of common and preferred shares issued by the Company for subsequent cancellation, disposal or to be held in treasury, without decreasing
	capital.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2016 and 2015,
	the Company had not acquired any shares under its repurchasing program to be held in treasury, for subsequent sale and/or cancellation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	h)
<U>
	Earnings per share
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Basic and diluted earnings per
	share were calculated by dividing profit attributed to the Company&rsquo;s shareholders by the weighted average number of outstanding
	common and preferred shares for the year.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The table below sets out the
	calculation of earnings per share for the years ended December 31, 2016 and 2015:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;

</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	General and administrative
	expenses
</FONT>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 0PT">
	The amount shown for 2016 includes R$476,371 (net of residual values) from
	the Company's sale of 1,655 of transmission towers to Telxius Torres Brasil Ltda (former Towerco Latam Brasil Ltda (Note 29)).
	After the sale of these assets, a lease agreement for part of the towers sold was entered into, thus ensuring continued transmission
	of data for mobile services.
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 14.2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The transaction was recognized
	as sale and leaseback as provided under IAS 17. Management analyzed each asset leased back and classified them as operating or
	finance leases in accordance with IAS 17 qualitative and quantitative criteria.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 14.2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 14.2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Risks and benefits relating
	to these towers have been transferred to their purchasers, with the exception of several towers for which transfer of risks and
	benefits was not possible. For these items, the amount was recognized as deferred revenue (Note 20).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 14.2PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
	(2)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 0PT">
	In the same transaction described in item (1), the Company transferred
	assignment of current lease agreements for sites and sold sharing agreements (customer portfolio) for R$40,899.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	75

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0">
<B>
	28) INCOME AND SOCIAL CONTRIBUTION TAXES
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	recognize income and social contribution taxes on a monthly basis, on an accrual basis, and pay the taxes based on estimates, in
	accordance with the trial balances for tax-reduction/tax-suspension purposes. Taxes calculated on profits until the month of the
	financial statements are recorded in liabilities or assets, as applicable.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: NORMAL">
	Reconciliation
	of the reported tax expense and the amounts calculated by applying the statutory tax rate of 34% (income tax of 25% and social
	contribution tax of 9%) is shown in the table below for the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
</P>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
	After Law No. 12973 came into force (Provisional Executive Order No. 627/13),
	published on May 14, 2014, the Company reviewed the tax bases for certain intangible assets resulting from business combinations,
	representing a positive net effect on deferred income and social contribution taxes amounting to R$1,195,989 for the year ended
	December 31, 2014.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	were R$488,450, R$970,671 and R$566,382 on December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014. These expenses were impacted due to adjustments of
	current income and social contribution taxes current from previous years. Any impacts on the reconciliation of effective rates
	were considered in the table above.
</FONT>

<B>
	29) BALANCES AND TRANSACTIONS WITH RELATED PARTIES

	group carried out at the prices and other commercial conditions agreed in contracts between the parties as follows:

<P STYLE="COLOR: RED; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: RED; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
	In March 2016, the Company entered into a purchase and sale agreements
	for infrastructure and assignment of leases, pooling and other covenants (&quot;Agreement&quot;) with Telxius Torres Brasil Ltda
	(former Towerco Latam Brasil Ltda) (a Telef&oacute;nica subsidiary). The subject matter of the agreement is the purchase and sale
	of 1,655 tower structures, assignment of current rental agreements for their sites and shared-use/ pooling agreements. The total
	amount involved was R$760,000, comprising R$719,101 relating to the tower infrastructures and R$40,899 relating to the customer
	portfolio.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 14.2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The agreement's conditions
	were established taking into consideration (i) prior transactions of the same nature performed by the Company and other companies
	in the industry; (ii) a valuation report for the assets subject matter of the agreement, prepared by an independent appraiser;
	and (iii) internal business plan showing that the operation is profitable for the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 14.2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 14.2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The following table summarizes
	the aforementioned transaction:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 8PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 14.2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="COLOR: RED; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 14.2PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>

</TD>
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>

</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<B>
	b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<B>
<U>
	Management compensation
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	Key management
	personnel compensation paid by the Company to its Board of Directors and Statutory Officers for the years ended December 31, 2016,
	2015 and 2014 totaled R$109,314, R$82,582 and R$22,174, respectively. Of this amount, R$39,822 (R$40,328 at December 31, 2015 and
	R$16,793 at December 31,2014) corresponds to salaries, benefits and social charges and R$69,492 (R$42,254 at December 31, 2015
	and R$5,381 at December 31, 2014) to variable compensation.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	These amounts
	were recorded as expenses with personnel under the General and administrative expenses group of accounts (Note 25).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	For the years
	ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company&rsquo;s Directors and Officers did not receive any pension, retirement pension
	or other similar benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<B>
	30)
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<B>
	INSURANCE COVERAGE
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The policy of the Company and
	its subsidiaries, as well as the Telef&oacute;nica Group, includes contracting insurance coverage for all assets and liabilities
	involving significant and high-risk amounts, based on management&rsquo;s judgment and following Telef&oacute;nica corporate program
	guidelines.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2016, maximum
	limits of claims (established pursuant to the agreements of each company by the Company) for significant assets, liabilities or
	interests covered by insurance and their respective amounts were R$1,047,826 for operational risks (with loss of profit) and R$75,000
	for general civil liability.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<B>
	31)
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<B>
	SHARE-BASED PAYMENT PLANS
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Telef&oacute;nica, as the Company's
	parent company, has different share-based payment plans based on the share quotes, which were also offered to management and employees
	of its subsidiaries, including Telef&ocirc;nica Brasil and the latter's subsidiaries.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair value of these options
	is estimated on the grant date, based on a binomial pricing model reflecting terms and conditions of instruments granted.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	reimburse Telef&oacute;nica for the amount of the fair value of the benefits granted to management and employees on the grant date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The main plans in effect at
	December 31, 2016 and 2015 are detailed below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<B>
	a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<B>
<U>
	Performance &amp; Investment Plan (&ldquo;PIP&rdquo;)
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Telef&oacute;nica's General
	Shareholders&rsquo; Meeting held on May 18, 2011 approved a long-term program for using Telef&oacute;nica stock options to reward
	senior management's global commitment, outstanding performance and high potential by awarding Telef&oacute;nica S.A. shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Participants are not required
	to pay for their initial stock options and may increase the number of shares to be received at the end of the plan if they decide
	to make a joint investment in their PIP, which requires a participant to buy the equivalent of 25% of the initial shares awarded
	by Telef&oacute;nica and hold them until the end of the cycle, when Telef&oacute;nica will add another 25% in addition to the initial
	amount of shares in their co-investment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Initially, the plan is expected
	to remain effective for 3 years. The cycles are independent of each other. The number of shares is reported at the beginning of
	each cycle and will be transferred to participants 3 years after the grant date assuming these professionals have met their targets.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The granting of shares is conditional
	on: (i) maintenance of an active employment relationship within the Telef&oacute;nica Group on the cycle consolidation date; and
	(ii) achievement, by Telef&oacute;nica, of results representing fulfillment of the objectives established for the plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The level of success is based
	on a comparison of the growth in shareholder earnings, considering stock quotations and dividends (Total Shareholder Return - TSR)
	with the growth in TSR for companies of the Group in an established basis of comparison.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 235; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	81
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage236"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP73142_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In 2014, the Company approved
	the extension of this program for another 3 cycles of 3 years each, beginning October 1, 2014 and extending to September 30, 2017.
	The number of shares is stated at the beginning of the cycle and three years after grant date, and shares are transferred to participants
	as long as TSR targets are met.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The 2012-2015 cycle was completed
	in June 2015, achieving the TSR targets. Sixty eight (68) of the Company's executives obtained the right to receive 258,552 Telef&oacute;nica
	shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The 2013-2016 cycle takes place
	in June 2016 and the TSR was not achieved, therefore Telef&oacute;nica shares were not awarded to the Company&rsquo;s executives.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The following cycles have been
	scheduled:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	4th cycle (October
	1, 2014 to September 30, 2017): 66 active Company executives (including 3 executives appointed under the Company&rsquo;s Articles
	of Incorporation) hold the right to potentially receive 365,215 Telef&oacute;nica shares (includes initial amounts and co-investment).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	5th Cycle (October
	1, 2015 the September 30, 2018): 106 active Company executives (including 3 executives appointed under the Articles of Incorporation)
	of the Company, hold the right to potentially receive 581,899 Telef&oacute;nica shares (includes initial amounts and co-investment).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2016, the value
	of Telef&oacute;nica&rsquo; share price was Eur 8.82.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<B>
	b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<B>
<U>
	Talent for the Future Share Plan (&ldquo;TFSP&rdquo;)
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Telef&oacute;nica's 2014 General
	Shareholders&rsquo; Meeting approved a long-term program to reward the global commitment, outstanding performance and high potential
	of its executives by awarding Telef&oacute;nica shares.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Participants are not required
	to pay for their initial options. Initially, the plan is expected to remain effective for 3 years. The cycle began on October 1,
	2014 and will be effective until September 30, 2017. The number of shares is reported at the beginning of the cycle and shares
	will be transferred to participants 3 years after grant date if their targets have been met.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The granting of shares is conditional
	upon: (i) maintenance of an active employment relationship within the Telef&oacute;nica Group on the cycle consolidation date;
	and (ii) achievement, by Telef&oacute;nica, of results representing fulfillment of the objectives established for the plan. The
	level of success is based on a comparison of growth in Telef&oacute;nica shareholder earnings, including their quotations and dividends
	(Total Shareholder Return - TSR) compared with the growth in TSR for Companies of the Group in an established basis of comparison.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The following cycles have been
	scheduled:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	1st cycle (October
	1, 2014 to September 30, 2017): with the right to potentially receive 58,000 Telef&oacute;nica shares (includes initial amounts).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL">
	&middot;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	2nd cycle (October
	1, 2015 to September 30, 2018): with the right to potentially receive 90,000 Telef&oacute;nica shares (includes initial amounts).
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2016, the value
	of Telef&oacute;nica&rsquo; share price was Eur 8.82.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.3PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 17.7PT">
<B>
	c)
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<B>
<U>
	Global Employee Share Plan (&ldquo;GESP&rdquo;)
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At the Telef&oacute;nica General
	Shareholders&rsquo; Meeting held on May 30, 2014, a share purchase plan under tax incentive was approved, intended for employees
	of Telef&oacute;nica Group at the international level, including the employees of the Company and its subsidiaries. This plan offers
	the possibility of acquiring Telef&oacute;nica shares with the commitment of the later to deliver free of charge to participants
	a given number of its shares, whenever certain requirements are met.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Initially, the plan was expected
	to remain effective for 2 years. Employees enrolled in the plan were able to acquire Telef&oacute;nica shares by making monthly
	contributions of 25 to 150 euros (or the equivalent in local currency) totaling at most 1,800 euros over 12 months (acquisition
	period).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Shares will be transferred on
	the plan's vesting date, at July 31, 2017 and is subject to the following conditions: (i) the permanence in the Company during
	the 2-year program period (vesting period), subject to certain special conditions related to terminations; and (ii) the exact number
	of shares to be granted at the end of the vesting period
	depends on the number of shares acquired and held by employees. Thus, employees enrolled with the plan, who remained in the Telef&oacute;nica
	Group and who have held the shares acquired for an additional period of over 12 months after the end of the purchase period, will
	be entitled to receive one free share for each share they have acquired and held until the end of the vesting period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The actuarial valuation of the
	plans was made in December 2016 and 2015, based on members registered at July 31, 2016 for the plans administered by Vis&atilde;oPrev
	and Sistel (except for registered health care plan members - Law No. 9656/98, at August 31 2016), both projected for December 31,
	2016 and based on members registered at July 31, 2015 for the plans administered by Vis&atilde;oPrev and Sistel (except for registered
	health care plan members - Law No. 9656/98, at April 30 2015), both projected for December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	The Company
	has participation in the decisions that directly affect the governance of the plans, with members nominated for both the Deliberative
	Council and the Fiscal Council of the administrators Sistel and Vis&atilde;oPrev.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	Sistel, as of
	December 31, 2016, had 12 members, 2 members appointed by the Company as part of its Deliberative Council. On the same date, Sistel
	had as part of its Fiscal Council, composed of 6 members, one member appointed by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	Vis&atilde;oPrev,
	as of December 31, 2016, had as part of its Deliberative Council, composed of 8 members, 5 members appointed by the Company. On
	that same date, Vis&atilde;oPrev had as its Fiscal Council, composed of 8 members, 5 members appointed by the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The actuarial gains and losses
	generated in each year are immediately recognized in equity (in other comprehensive income).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 237; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	83
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage238"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP73142_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The defined benefit obligation
	is made up of different components, according to the pension characteristic of each plan, and may include the actuarial liabilities
	of supplementary pension liabilities, health care benefits to retirees and dependents or compensation for death or disability of
	members. This liability is exposed to economic and demographic risks, such as: (i) increases in medical costs that could impact
	the cost of health care plans; (ii) salary growth; (iii) long-term inflation rate; (iv) nominal discount rate; and (v) life expectancy
	of members and pensioners.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair value of plan assets
	is primarily comprised of fixed income investments (NTN's, LFT, LTN's, repurchase agreements, CDBs, debentures, letters of guarantee
	and FIDC shares) and equity investments (highly liquid, well regarded, large company shares and investments in market indices).
	Due to the concentration of fixed income and floating rate investments plan assets are mainly exposed to the risks inherent in
	the financial market and economic environment such as: (i) market risk in the economic sectors where variable income investments
	are concentrated; (ii) risk events that impact the economic environment and market indices where variable income investments are
	concentrated; and (iii) the long-term inflation rate that may erode the profitability of fixed-income investments at fixed rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The companies that administer
	post-employment benefits plans sponsored by the Company (Vis&atilde;oPrev and Sistel) seek to meet the flows of assets and liabilities
	through the acquisition of fixed income securities and other long-term assets.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	With the exception of the CTB
	deficit plans and the healthcare plan under Law No. 9656/98 all other plan benefits have a surplus position. The economic benefit
	recorded in the Company's assets or that of its subsidiaries does not reflect the total surplus determined in these plans. The
	economic benefit stated under assets considers only the portion of the surplus that is actually recoverable. The means of plan
	surplus recovery is solely through reductions in future contributions and given that not all plans currently receive enough contributions
	for full recovery of surpluses, the economic benefit recorded under assets is limited to the total possible recovery amount in
	accordance with projected future contributions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The position of plan assets
	is at December 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively, and plan assets were apportioned based on the company&rsquo;s actuarial liabilities
	in relation to the total actuarial liabilities of the plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The following is a summary of
	the pension plans and other post-employment benefits:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<B>
	a)
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<B>
<U>
	Post-retirement Health Plans
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	a.1)
<U>
	Healthcare Plan to Retirees
	and Special Coverage Program (PAMA and PAMA-PCE)
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company, together with other
	companies of the former Telebr&aacute;s System, at shared cost, sponsor health care plans (PAMA and PAMA-PCE) for retirees. These
	plans are managed by Funda&ccedil;&atilde;o Sistel and are closed plans, not admitting new members.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Contributions to the plans are
	determined based on actuarial valuations prepared by independent actuaries, in accordance with the rules in force in Brazil. The
	funding procedure is the capitalization method and the sponsor&rsquo;s contribution is at the fixed percentage of 1.5% of payroll
	of employees covered by the Telef&ocirc;nica BD plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sistel&rsquo;s ordinary Deliberative
	Board&rsquo;s Meeting of September 30, 2015, approved the setting up of a compensation and solvency fund, formed by the resources
	of the special reserve of the PBS-A plan, to cover exclusively PAMA&rsquo;s financial insufficiency, for the sole purpose of abiding
	by a final unappeasable court decision. This court ruling obliges sponsors (including the Company) to maintain the PAMA plan with
	the original coverage conditions and renegotiate the existing deficit.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In function of the extinction
	of the deficit related to the PAMA in December 2015, the Company wrote-off the actuarial liability related to PAMA in the amount
	of R$430,335, matched against other comprehensive income (R$284,021 net of taxes).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	a.2)
<U>
	Health care plan &ndash;
	Law No. 9656/98
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company manages and individually
	sponsors a health care plan to retired employees and former employees with fixed contributions to the plan, in accordance with
	Law No. 9656/98.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 238; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	84
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage239"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP73142_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As provided for in articles
	30 and 31 of said law, participants shall have the right to the health care plan in which they participated while they were active
	employees. Benefitted participants are classified as retirees and their dependents and dismissed employees and their dependents.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Retirees and dismissed employees,
	in order to keep their right to the benefits, must make contributions to the plan in accordance with the contribution tables by
	age bracket established by carriers and/or insurance companies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 14.2PT">
<B>
	b)
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<B>
<U>
	Post-Employment Pension Plans
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	They include the PBS Assisted
	Plans (&ldquo;PBS-A&quot;), CTB, Telef&ocirc;nica BD, Prev and Vis&atilde;o, described below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Contributions to the CTB and
	Telef&ocirc;nica BD plans are determined based on actuarial valuations prepared by independent actuaries, in accordance with the
	rules in force in Brazil. The funding procedure is the capitalization method and the sponsor&rsquo;s contribution is a fixed percentage
	of payroll of employees covered by the plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	b.1)
<U>
	PBS Assisted Plan (PBS-A)
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The PBS-A plan is a defined
	benefit private pension plan managed by Sistel and sponsored by the Company jointly with the other telecommunications companies
	originating in the privatization of the Telebr&aacute;s system. The plan is subject to funding by sponsors in case of any asset
	insufficiency to ensure pension supplementation of participants in the future.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The PBS-A plan comprises assisted
	participants of the Sistel Benefit Plan who were already retirees on January 31, 2000, from all the participating sponsors, with
	joint liability of all sponsors to the plan and Sistel.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Although the PBS-A plan has
	assets in excess of actuarial liabilities at December 31, 2016 and 2015, such surplus was not recognized due to lack of legal provision
	in relation to refund thereof, in addition, since it is not a contributive plan, it is not possible to make any deduction from
	future contributions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sistel&rsquo;s ordinary Deliberative
	Board&rsquo;s meeting of September 30, 2015, approved the discontinuation of the special reserve in connection with the review
	of the PBS-A plan, referring to 2009, 2010 and 2011, with the consequent formation of the Compensation and Solvency Fund.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Compensation and Solvency
	Fund was destined by Sistel&rsquo;s Executive Board to cover PAMA financial insufficiency, exclusively to abide by a final unappeasable
	court decision. This court ruling obliges sponsors (including the Company) to keep PAMA with the original coverage conditions and
	even up the existing deficit. Thereafter, Sistel must determine in the annual actuarial assessments of the PBS-A plan any existing
	exceeding amounts, in addition to the contingent reserve of 25%, to meet PAMA cash needs.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	b.2)
<U>
	CTB Plan
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company also individually
	manages and sponsors the CTB Plan, originally provided to former employees of Companhia Telef&ocirc;nica Brasileira (&ldquo;CTB&rdquo;)
	who were in the Company in 1977, with whom an individual retirement concession agreement was executed to encourage their resignation.
	This is an informal pension supplementation benefit paid to former employees directly by the Company. In the event that the former
	employee is deceased, the spouse will be entitled to 50% of the benefit amount upon death. These plans are closed, and no other
	members are admitted.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	b.3)
<U>
	Telef&ocirc;nica DB
	Plan
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company individually sponsors
	defined benefit retirement plan, the Telef&ocirc;nica DB Plan (former PBS Telesp plan).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In order to improve allocation
	of Telef&ocirc;ncia DB plan assets and analyze the coverage ratio of plan obligations in future years, a stochastic ALM study was
	prepared by Vis&atilde;o Prev and Willis Towers Watson. This ALM study aimed at projecting the ratio between coverage of liabilities
	(solvency ratio) and the risk of mismatching measured by the standard deviation of the solvency ratio. The study concluded that
	the PBS plans present sustainable projection of their coverage ratio with the current investments portfolio.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 239; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	85
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage240"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP73142_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Vis&atilde;o Prev obtained approval
	from the National Superintendence of Supplementary Pension (&ldquo;PREVIC&rdquo;) for plan merger to simplify structures and unify
	regulations. On January 27, 2015, PREVIC approved merger of PBS Tele Sudeste Celular plan with the Telef&ocirc;nica DB plan. On
	December 28, 2015, PREVIC approved the process of incorporation of the PBS Telemig Celular plan by the Telef&ocirc;nica DB plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	b.4)
<U>
	PREV Plans
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company individually sponsors
	hybrid defined benefit and defined contribution retirement plans, the PREV plans, managed by Vis&atilde;o Prev. PREV plans include:
	(i) Vivoprev Plan; and (ii) Tcoprev Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Contributions to PREV plans
	are: (i)
<U>
	basic contribution:
</U>
	percentage of participation salary, where the sponsor also contributes the amount equivalent
	to the basic contribution of the participant; (ii)
<U>
	supplementary or voluntary contribution
</U>
	: percentage over the participation
	salary, in which there is no counterpart contribution from the sponsor; and (iii)
<U>
	sporadic contribution:
</U>
	with amount value
	and periodicity defined by the participant, in which there is no counterpart contribution from the sponsor. In addition to these
	contributions, the sponsor may make occasional voluntary contributions, apportioned in proportion to the basic contribution of
	the participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In order to improve allocation
	of Tcoprev plan assets and analyze the coverage ratio of plan obligations in future years, a stochastic ALM study was prepared
	by Vis&atilde;o Prev and Willis Towers Watson. This ALM study aimed at projecting the ratio between coverage of liabilities (solvency
	ratio) and the risk of mismatching measured by the standard deviation of the solvency ratio. The study concluded that the Tcoprev
	plan present sustainable projection of its coverage ratio with the current investments portfolio.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On September 21, 2015, PREVIC
	approved merger of the Tcpprev and Celprev Telemig plans with Vis&atilde;o Telef&ocirc;nica plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	b.5)
<U>
	VIS&Atilde;O Plans
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Vis&atilde;o Telef&ocirc;ncia,
	Vis&atilde;o Multi and Vis&atilde;o Tgestiona plans will hereinafter be shown jointly under the name VIS&Atilde;O, due to their
	similarity.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	sponsor defined contribution pension plans with defined benefit components (hybrid plans), i.e. the VIS&Atilde;O Plans, managed
	by Vis&atilde;o Prev. The VIS&Atilde;O plans include: (i) Vis&atilde;o Telef&ocirc;nica Plan; (ii) Multi Vis&atilde;o Plan and
	(iii) Vis&atilde;o Tgestiona Plan.
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: #222222">
	The contribution is attributed to each subsidiary in the economic
	and demographic proportion of its respective obligation to the plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The contributions made by the
	Company related to defined contribution plans totaled R$37,879 at December 31, 2016 (R$20,092 at December 31, 2015).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The contributions to the VIS&Atilde;O
	plans are the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Vis&atilde;o Telef&ocirc;nica
	Plan:
</U>
	(i)
<U>
	basic contribution:
</U>
	percentage of participation salary, where the sponsor contributes the amount equivalent
	to the basic contribution of the participant; (ii)
<U>
	additional contribution:
</U>
	percentage over the participation salary, where
	the sponsor contributes the amount equivalent to the basic contribution of the participant; (iii)
<U>
	sporadic contribution:
</U>
	percentage of the participant's choice of participation salary, in which there is no counterpart contribution from the sponsor;
	(iv)
<U>
	specific contribution:
</U>
	percentage on bonuses, participation in profits and results or any other payment made by the
	sponsor, in which there is no counterpart contribution from the sponsor; and (v)
<U>
	additional contribution:
</U>
	with amount and
	periodicity defined by the participant, in which there is no counterpart contribution from the sponsor. In addition to these contributions,
	the sponsor may make occasional voluntary contributions, apportioned in proportion to the basic contribution of the participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Multi Vis&atilde;o Plan:
</U>
	(i)
<U>
	basic contribution:
</U>
	percentage of the participation salary, where the sponsor also contributes the amount in proportion
	to the employee's time of admission with the amount equivalent to the basic contribution of the participant; (ii)
<U>
	additional
	contribution:
</U>
	additional contribution: percentage over the participation salary, where the sponsor also contributes the amount
	proportionally to the amount equivalent to the time of admission of the basic contribution of the participating employee; (iii)
<U>
	sporadic contribution:
</U>
	sporadic contribution: with value and periodicity defined by the percentage of the participant's
	choice, in which there is no counterpart contribution from the sponsor; and (iv)
<U>
	specific contribution:
</U>
	percentage on bonuses,
	profit sharing or any other payment made by the sponsor, in which there is no counterpart contribution from the sponsor. In addition
	to these contributions, the sponsor may make occasional voluntary contributions, apportioned in proportion to the basic contribution
	of the participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 240; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	86
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage241"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%">
<A HREF="#DP73142_20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Vis&atilde;o Tgestiona Plan:
</U>
	The subsidiary TGLOG sponsors, together with other sponsors, the Vis&atilde;o Tgestiona Plan. This plan has the features of the
	VIS&Atilde;O plans, it is a defined contribution pension plan with defined benefit components (hybrid plans), and is managed by
	Vis&atilde;o Prev.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The participant can contribute
	to the Vis&atilde;o Tgestiona plan as follows: (i)
<U>
	basic contribution:
</U>
	percentage of 2% of participation salary for participants
	with membership up to November 30, 2008 and 1% of participation salary for participants with 11/30/2008; (ii)
<U>
	additional contribution:
</U>
	optional contribution with a percentage of 0% to 7% over the portion of the participation salary that exceeds 9 (nine) Standard
	Reference Units of the plan for participants with membership up to 11/30/2008 and a percentage of 0 % to 5% on the portion of the
	participation salary that exceeds the 9 (nine) Standard Reference Units of the plan for participants with membership after 11/30/2008;
	(iii)
<U>
	specific contribution:
</U>
	full percentage applicable to bonuses, profit sharing and any other payment made by the sponsor;
	and (iv)
<U>
	additional contribution:
</U>
	with value and periodicity defined by the participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The sponsor also contributes
	with 100% of the basic contribution and the additional contribution made by the participants with adhesion until 11/30/2008. For
	participants joining after 11/30/2008, the sponsor also contributes in return for the basic and additional contributions of the
	participants, in different proportions, according to the time of admission of the employee, being: up to 5 years of service, contribution
	of 30 % of the participant's contributions; 5 to 10 years of service, contribution of 60% of the participant's contributions; and
	over 10 years of service, contribution of 100% of the participant's contributions. For the specific and supplementary contributions
	there is no counterpart contribution from the sponsor. In addition to these contributions, the sponsor may make the voluntary contribution,
	of a sporadic nature, being apportioned in proportion to the basic contribution of the participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	On September 21, 2015, PREVIC
	approved the merger of the Vis&atilde;o Telerj Celular, Vis&atilde;o Telest Celular, Vis&atilde;o Telebahia Celular, Vis&atilde;o
	Telergipe Celular and Vis&atilde;o Celular CRT by the Vis&atilde;o Telef&ocirc;nica Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	c)
<U>
	Information on Pension
	Plans and Other Post-Employment Benefits
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	c.1)
<U>
	Reconciliation of assets
	and liabilities:
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>

<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	156,270
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	c.12)
<U>
	Changes in actuarial
	assumptions in relation to the prior year
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In order to adjust some actuarial
	assumptions to the economic and demographic reality, a study was conducted for the plans administered by Vis&atilde;o Prev and
	Sistel, which adopted the definition of the assumptions in their Deliberative Councils.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The main economic and financial
	assumptions that have changed in relation to the previous fiscal year and that interfere with the defined benefit liability are:
	(i) rates for discount to present value of the defined benefit liability; (ii) long-term inflation rate; (iii) rate of future wage
	growth; (iv) rate of growth of medical costs; and (v) annual nominal index of adjustment of social security benefits.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The impacts on the plans&rsquo;
	defined benefit liabilities due to the new definition of the actuarial assumptions are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	c.13)
<U>
	Sensitivity analysis
	for actuarial assumptions
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company believes that the
	significant actuarial assumptions with reasonable likelihood of variation due to financial and economic scenarios, which could
	significantly change the amount of the defined benefit obligation, are the discount rate used to adjust the defined benefit liability
	to present value and the rate of growth of medical costs.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Sensitivity analysis of the
	defined benefit liability for scenarios involving a 0.5% increase and a 0.5% decrease in the discount rate used to discount the
	defined benefit liability to present value is as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_124"></A>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 49%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID; WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 0.5PT SOLID; WIDTH: 12%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	12.31.16
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<B>
	33)
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<B>
	FINANCIAL INSTRUMENTS AND RISK AND CAPITAL MANAGEMENT
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	a)
<U>
	Derivative financial
	instruments
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The derivative financial instruments
	contracts at the Company are mainly intended to hedge against foreign exchange risk arising from assets and liabilities in foreign
	currency, against risk of inflation of its debentures and lease indexed to the IPCA and against the risk of changes in TJLP of
	a portion of debt with BNDES. There are no, derivative financial instruments for speculative purposes and possible currency risks
	are hedged.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Management understands that
	the Company's internal controls for its derivatives are adequate to control risks associated with each strategy for the market.
	Gains/losses obtained or sustained by the Company in relation to its derivatives show that its risk management has been appropriate.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company calculates the effectiveness
	of the derivative financial instruments to hedge its financial liabilities and cash flows in foreign currency at the beginning
	of the operation and on an ongoing basis. At December 31, 2016 and 2015, the derivative financial instruments were effective for
	the hedged items.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	As long as these derivatives
	financial instruments qualify for hedge accounting, the risk covered may also be adjusted to fair value, offsetting the result
	of derivatives, according to the rules of hedge accounting. This hedge accounting applies both to financial liabilities and probable
	cash flows in foreign currency
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2016 and 2015,
	the Company held no embedded derivatives financial instruments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	Derivatives
</FONT>
	financial instruments
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: WINDOWTEXT">
	includes specific penalties for breach of contract. Breach of contract
	provided for in agreements made with financial institutions leads to the early settlement thereof.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	a.1)
<U>
	Fair value of derivative
	financial instruments
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The valuation method used to
	calculate the fair value of financial liabilities (if applicable) and derivative financial instruments was the discounted cash
	flow method, based on expected settlements or realization of liabilities and assets at market rates prevailing at the balance sheet
	date.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair values of positions
	in Reais are calculated by projecting future inflows from transactions using BM&amp;FBovespa yield curves discounting these flows
	to present value using market DI rates for
<I>
	swaps
</I>
	announced by BM&amp;FBovespa.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The market values of foreign-exchange
	derivatives were obtained using the market exchange rates in effect at the balance sheet date and projected market rates obtained
	from the currency's coupon-rate yield curves. The linear convention of 360 calendar days was used to determine coupon rates of
	positions indexed in foreign currencies, while the exponential convention of 252 business days was used to determine coupon rates
	for positions indexed to CDI rates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Derivatives financial instruments
	shown below are registered with Brazils&rsquo; OTC Clearing House (&ldquo;CETIP&rdquo;) and classified as swaps, usually, that
	do not require margin deposits.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 246; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	92

</P>
