<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For the purposes of preparing
	its financial statements, the Company adopted the fair value hedge accounting methodology for its foreign currency swaps x CDI,
	IPCA x CDI, IGPM x CDI and TJLP x CDI for hedging or financial debt. Under this arrangement, both derivatives and hedged risk are
	recognized at fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The ineffective portion at December
	31, 2016 was R$2,091 (R$2,836 at December 31, 2015).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2016, 2015 and
	2014, the transactions with derivatives generated negative (net) result of R$347,870 and positive of R$899,059 and R$98,329, respectively
	(Note 27).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	a.2)
<U>
	Sensitivity analysis
	to the Company&rsquo;s risk variables
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	CVM Resolution 604/09 requires
	listed companies to comply with IFRS 7 by disclosing sensitivity analyses for each type of market risk that management understands
	to be significant when originated by financial instruments to which the entity is exposed at the end of each period, including
	all derivatives financial instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In making the above analysis,
	each of the transactions with derivative financial instruments was assessed and assumptions included a probable scenario and two
	others that could adversely impact the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In the probable scenario the
	assumption is to keep, on the maturity dates of each of the transaction, what the market had been showing through BM&amp;FBovespa
	yield curves (currencies and interest rates), as well as data available at CETIP, IBGE, Central Bank, FGV, among others. In the
	probable scenario, there is no impact on the fair value of the above-mentioned derivatives. However, for scenarios II and III,
	as per CVM ruling, risk variables were considered to deteriorate by 25% and 50% respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Since the Company only holds
	derivatives to hedge its foreign-currency assets and liabilities, changing scenarios are tracked by the corresponding hedged items,
	thus showing that effects are almost non-existent. For these transactions, the Company reported the net exposure in each of the
	above-mentioned three scenarios at December 31, 2016.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 248; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	94
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The assumptions used by the
	Company for the sensitivity analysis at December 31, 2016 were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Sensitivity analysis assumptions
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	For calculation of the net exposure
	for the sensitivity analysis, all derivatives were considered at market value and hedged items designated for hedge for accounting
	purposes were also considered at fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair values shown in the
	table above are based on the portfolio position at December 31, 2016, but do not reflect an estimate for realization due to the
	dynamism of the market, which is constantly monitored by the Company. The use of different assumptions could significantly affect
	the estimates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	b)
<U>
	Fair value
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	assessed their financial assets and liabilities in relation to market values using available information and appropriate valuation
	methodologies. However, both the interpretation of market data and the selection of valuation methods require considerable judgment
	and reasonable estimates to produce the most adequate realization value. As a result, the estimates shown do not necessarily indicate
	amounts that could be realized in the current market. The use of different assumptions for the market and/or methodologies may
	have a material effect on estimated realization values. At December 31, 2016 and 2015, neither the Company not its subsidiaries
	detected any significant and enduring impairment of their financial instruments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The fair value of all assets
	and liabilities are classified within the fair value hierarchy described below, based on the lowest level of information that is
	significant to the fair value measurement as a whole:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<BR>
<U>
	Level 1:
</U>
	quoted market prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
<BR>
<U>
	Level 2:
</U>
	valuation techniques for which significant lower level of information to measure the fair value directly or indirectly
	observable; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
<BR>
<U>
	Level 3:
</U>
	valuation techniques for which the lowest and significant level of information to measure the fair value is not
	available.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	During years ended December
	31, 2016 and 2015, there were no transfers between fair value measurements of level 3 and level 1 and 2.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 250; VALUE: 1 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	F-
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	96
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	c)
<U>
	Capital management
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The purpose of the Company's
	capital management is to ensure maintenance of a high credit rating before institutions and an optimal capital ratio in order to
	support the Company's business and maximize shareholder value.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company manages its capital
	structure by making adjustments and adapting to current economic conditions. For this purpose, the Company may pay dividends, raise
	new loans, issue promissory notes and derivatives financial instruments. For the year ended December 31, 2016, there were no changes
	in capital structure objectives, policies or processes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In its net debt structure, the
	Company includes balances referring to loans, financing, debentures, finance lease, contingent consideration (Note 21) and derivatives
	financial instruments (Note 33), less cash and cash equivalents (Note 5) and short-term investments to secure BNB financing.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company&rsquo;s ratio of
	debt to equity consists of the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>

	F-

<A NAME="eolPage252"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	Table of Contents

<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	d)
<U>
	Risk management policy
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	are exposed to several market risks as a result of its commercial operations, debts contracted to finance its activities and debt-related
	financial instruments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	d.1)
<U>
	Currency Risk
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	There is risk arising from the
	possibility that the Company may incur losses due to fluctuating exchange rates, which add to costs arising from loans denominated
	in foreign currencies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2016, 14.0%
	of financial debt was foreign-currency denominated (16.5% at December 31, 2015). The Company enters into derivative financial instruments
	(currency hedge) with financial institutions to hedge against exchange rate variation affecting its total indebtedness in foreign
	currency (R$1,287,864 and R$1,681,968 at 31 December 2016 and 2015, respectively). Its total debt on these dates was covered by
	asset positions in currency-exchange hedge transactions with CDI-rate swaps.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	There is also foreign exchange
	risk for non-financial assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies, which may generate a smaller amount receivable
	or larger amount payable depending on the exchange rate in the period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Hedging transactions were engaged
	to minimize the risks associated with exchange-rate variation of non-financial assets and liabilities in foreign currencies. This
	balance is subject to daily changes due to the dynamics of the business. However, the Company intends to cover the net balance
	of these rights and obligations (US$17,293 thousand receivable and &euro;5,695 thousand payable by December 31, 2016 and US$32,030
	thousand and &euro;19,079 thousand payable by December 31, 2015) to mitigate its foreign exchange risks.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	d.2)
<U>
	Interest and Inflation
	Risk
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	This risk arises because the
	Company may incur losses in the event of an unfavorable change in the domestic interest rate, which may adversely affect financial
	expenses resulting from the portion of debentures referenced to the CDI and liability positions in derivatives (currency hedge,
	IPCA and TJLP) pegged to floating interest rates (CDI).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The debt with BNDES is indexed
	to the Long-Term Interest Rate (TJLP), which is set on a quarterly basis by the National Monetary Council. In March 2015, the National
	Monetary Council decided to increase the annual rate to 6.00% from April 1 to June 30, 2015. The TJLP rose 0.50 percentage points
	from the previous annual rate of 5.50%. In the course of 2015, the TJLP was raised to 6.5% for the period from July to September
	and to 7.0% for the period from October to December. In 2016, the TJLP was raised to 7.5%.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Inflation risk arises from the
	Minas Comunica debentures of the 1
<SUP>
	st
</SUP>
	issue, which are tied to the IPCA and thus may adversely affect financial expenses
	in the event of an unfavorable change in this index.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	To reduce exposure to the variable
	interest rate (CDI), the Company and its subsidiaries invested their cash equivalents of R$4,906,741 at December 31, 2016 (R$5,103,103
	at December 31, 2015), mostly in short-term CDI-based financial investments (Bank Deposit Certificates). The carrying amounts of
	these instruments approach their fair values, since they may be redeemed in short term.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	d.3)
<U>
	Liquidity Risk
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Liquidity risk is the possibility
	of the Company or its subsidiaries not holding sufficient funds to meet their commitments due to different currencies and dates
	of realization of rights and settlement of obligations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company structure the maturity
	dates of non-derivative financial instruments, as shown in Note 21, and their respective derivatives, as shown in the schedule
	of payments disclosed in this note, to avoid affecting their liquidity.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company cash flow and liquidity
	and those of its subsidiaries are managed on a daily basis by the departments in charge to ensure that operating cash flows and
	prior funding, when necessary, will be sufficient to meet their schedule of commitments in order to avoid liquidity risk.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 252; VALUE: 1 -->

<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(213,234,234)">
<TD>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	Trade accounts payable (Note 16)

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	d.4)
<U>
	Credit Risk
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The risk arises from the possibility
	of the Company and its subsidiaries incurring losses due to difficulty in receiving amounts billed to their customers and sales
	of prepaid handsets and cards that have been pre-activated for the distribution network.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The credit risk on accounts
	receivable is diversified and mitigated by strict control of the customer base. The Company constantly monitors the level of accounts
	receivable from postpaid services, and limits bad-debt risk by cutting off access to telephone lines if bills are past due. The
	mobile customer base predominantly uses the prepaid system, which requires purchase of credits beforehand and therefore does not
	pose credit risk. Exceptions are made for telecommunications services that must be maintained for security or national defense
	reasons.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Credit risk on sales of pre-activated
	prepaid handsets and cards is managed by a conservative policy for granting credit, using modern credit scoring methods, analyzing
	financial statements and consultations to commercial databases, in addition to requesting guarantees.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	are also subject to credit risk arising from their investments, letters of guarantee received as collateral for certain transactions
	and receivables from derivative financial instruments. The Company and its subsidiaries control the credit limits granted to each
	counterpart and diversify this exposure across first tier financial institutions as per current credit policies of financial counterparties.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	d.5)
<U>
	Social and Environmental Risks
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Our operations and properties
	are subject to various environmental laws and regulations that, among others, govern environmental licenses and records, protection
	of fauna and flora, air emissions, waste management and remediation of contaminated sites. If we fail to meet present and future
	requirements, or to identify and manage new or existing contamination, we will incur in significant costs, which include cleaning
	costs, damages, compensation, fines, activities suspension and other penalties, investments to improve our facilities or change
	our processes, or interruption of operations. The identification of environmental conditions not currently identified, more stringent
	inspections by regulatory agencies, the entry into force of more stringent laws and regulations or other unanticipated events may
	occur and, ultimately, result in significant environmental liabilities and their costs. The occurrence of any of the above factors
	could have a material adverse effect on our business, results of operations and financial position. According to Article 75 of
	Law No. 9605 of 1998, the maximum fine per breach of environmental law is R$50,000,000 (fifty million reais).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	From the social point of view,
	we are exposed to contingent liabilities due to the fact that our structure provides for the hiring of outsourced service providers.
	These potential liabilities may involve labor claims by service providers which are treated as direct employees and claim joint
	liability resulting from overtime and occupational accidents. If we obtain unfavorable decision with respect to a significant portion
	of these contingencies and if we have not recognized a provision for these risks, our financial position and results of operations
	may be adversely affected. In addition, if the labor authorities consider that outsourcing services involves core activities of
	the company, this could be considered employment relationship, which would significantly increase
	our costs and therefore subject the Company to administrative proceedings and, payment of fines to third parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 253; VALUE: 1 -->

	F-

	99

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	d.6)
<U>
	Other Risks
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0.25IN; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company is required to comply
	with Brazilian anti-corruption laws and regulations, as well as laws and regulations on the same subject in jurisdictions where
	it has its securities traded. In particular, the Company is subject, in Brazil, to the Law n&ordm; 12.846/2013 and, in the United
	States, to the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Although the Company has internal
	policies and procedures designed to ensure compliance with the aforementioned anti-corruption laws and regulations, there can be
	no assurance that such policies and procedures will be sufficient or that&nbsp;the Company&rsquo;s employees, directors, officers,
	partners, agents and service providers will not take actions in violation of the Company&rsquo;s policies and procedures (or otherwise
	in violation of the relevant anti-corruption laws and regulations) for which the Company or they may be ultimately held responsible.
	Violations of anti-corruption laws and regulations could lead to financial penalties, damage to the Company&rsquo;s reputation
	or other legal consequences that could have a material adverse effect on the Company&rsquo;s business, results of operations and
	financial condition.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	In connection with the above-mentioned
	policies, the Company is currently conducting an internal investigation - which is part of a broader investigation being conducted
	by the controlling shareholder of the Company (Telef&oacute;nica, S.A.) - regarding possible violations of the abovementioned laws
	and regulations.&nbsp; The Company is in contact with governmental authorities about this matter and intends to cooperate with
	those authorities as the investigation continues.&nbsp; It is not possible at this time to predict the scope or duration of this
	matter or its likely outcome.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<B>
	34)
</B>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; PADDING-RIGHT: 14.15PT">
<B>
	COMMITMENTS AND GUARANTEES (RENTALS)
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The Company and its subsidiaries
	lease equipment, facilities, and several stores, administrative buildings, and sites (containing radio-base stations and towers),
	through several non-cancellable operating agreements maturing on different dates, with monthly payments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At December 31, 2016, the total
	amounts corresponding to the full period of the contracts were as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 12PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -12PT; COLOR: RED">
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_134"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE; WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: RGB(213,234,234)">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 87%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	Up to 1 year
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 12%; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
	2,102,820
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: WHITE">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	From 1 to 5 years
</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>

<B>
	35)
	PRO FORMA INCOME STATEMENTS (UNAUDITED OR REVIEWED)

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: RED">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<U>
	Notes to the income statements
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	a)
<U>
	Basis of preparation of income statements
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The historical financial information for
	the Company and GVTPart., as used in the preparation of these income statements, was obtained from the historical financial statements
	for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	These pro forma financial reports should
	be read in conjunction with the historical financial statements of the companies involved.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The income statements reflect the effects
	of acquiring 100% of the share capital of GVTPart. and have been prepared and presented solely for information purposes assuming
	the acquisition of GVTPart. to have taken place on January 1, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The income statements should not be used
	as an indication of future consolidated quarterly statements or taken as the Company&rsquo;s income statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	b)
<U>
	Pro forma adjustments
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The income statements were prepared
	and presented based on each company's historical quarterly financial statements and pro forma adjustments were determined based
	on assumptions and estimates, which we believe are reasonable.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	The adjustments shown in the
	income statements reflect: (i) depreciation of surplus value (capital loss) of property and equipment; (ii) amortization of surplus
	value (capital loss) of intangible assets; (iii) amortizations of trademark; (iv) amortizations of the customer base; (v) Income
	tax (25%) and social contribution tax (9%) and (vi) inter-company eliminations as shown below:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	36)
	ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON CASH FLOWS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 11.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -11.9PT">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 11.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -11.9PT">
	The
	main transactions of investments and financing that do not involve cash are as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 11.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -11.9PT">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 11.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -11.9PT; COLOR: RED">
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 11.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -11.9PT; COLOR: RED">
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 11.9PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -11.9PT; COLOR: RED">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
<B>
	37) SUBSEQUENT
	EVENTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
<B>
	a)
<U>
	Partial
	payment of 700 MHz licenses
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	On January 31,
	2017, the Company paid R$858,991 to EAD, referring to the 2nd and 3rd installments of the auction of 700 MHz national frequency
	bands for the provision of SMP, performed by ANATEL on September 30, 2014 (note 22).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
<B>
	b)
<U>
	Issuance
	of Debentures
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	At a meeting
	held on January 26, 2017, the Company's Board of Directors resolved to hold the 5th issue of simple debentures, non-convertible
	into shares of the Company, in a single series, unsecured, in the total amount of R$2 billion, which were subject to public placement
	with restricted efforts, under a firm guarantee regime, under the terms of ICVM 476/09.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	On February
	8, 2017, the Company issued 200,000 debentures, with unit par value equivalent to R$10,000 (ten thousand reais). The debentures
	have a maturity of 5 years and the unit par value of each debenture is not subject to monetary restatement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	Interest corresponding
	to 108.25% of the accumulated variation of the CDI.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
<BR>
	The net proceeds obtained by the Company with this issuance will be fully used for reprofiling the Company's financial liabilities,
	taking into account the Company's ordinary management business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; COLOR: #222222">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	c)
<U>
	Interim interest on equity decided
	by the Company
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	At a meeting held on February
	13, 2017, calling upon the General Shareholders&rsquo; Meeting, the Board of Directors approved the payment of interest on equity
	for the fiscal year 2017, under the terms of article 28 of the Company&rsquo;s Articles of Incorporation, article 9 of Law No.
	9249/95 and CVM Ruling No. 638/12, in the gross amount of R$180,000, equivalent to R$0.09996509791 per common share and R$0.10996160770
	per preferred share, corresponding to a net amount of Withholding Income Tax (IRRF) of R$153,000, equivalent to R$0.08497033323
	per common share and R$0.09346736655 per preferred share, calculated based on the net income stated in the balance sheet as of
	January 31, 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	Payment thereof will be made
	up to the end of fiscal year 2018, on a date to be set by the Board of Directors and timely communicated to the market, being paid
	individually to shareholders, according to the ownership structure contained in the Company's records, through the end of day February
	24, 2017.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT ARIAL, HELVETICA, SANS-SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 14.15PT 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
